tweets.controller

Class TweetController

  • java.lang.Object
    • tweets.controller.TweetController

  • @Controller
public class TweetController
extends Object
    This class's purpose is to control the Tweet model and the TrianingTweet model (deleting, updating) so that it can be used later on in the Client side.
    Author:
    Dalia Mostafa

        @CrossOrigin(origins="http://localhost:63342")
 @RequestMapping(value="/tt")
 @ResponseBody
public List<TrainingTweet> getTrainingTweets()
                                                                                                                                  throws IOException
        Fetches a list of all Training Tweets and writes them to a CSV file. It also makes sure that all training tweets are represented in N,B, and R symbols instead of the numbers assigned to the training tweets previously.
        Returns:
        trainingTweets List of TrainingTweets
        Throws:
        IOException - an IOException is thrown if the writing process is interrupted or failed

      • getDailyTweetsRates

        @CrossOrigin(origins="http://localhost:63342")
 @RequestMapping(value="/Dates")
 @ResponseBody
public List<DailyTweets> getDailyTweetsRates()
        This method aims to send JSON objects to the Frontend side for the line graph. The objects returned represent how many risk/benefit/neutral tweets were posted on a certain date.
        In this method we use a hashmap that has a date as its key and an TypeOfTweets object as a value.
        First, the method gets tweets from getTweets() method, then checks what type they are (risk/benefit/neutral) and the date they were posted on, and based on the date of each tweet brings the suitable TypeOfTweet object from the hashmap. It then increments the number of that type of tweet in the TypeOfTweets object.
        After that, it loops over all the tweets then creates a DailyTweets object for each date, adding the number of benefit, neutral and risk tweets for each DailyTweets pbject. Each DailyTweets object is added to a list called dailyTweets, which is sorted according to date, then returned.
        Returns:
        List <DailyTweets> dailyTweets

      • addZero

        public String addZero(int cal)
        This method is used to add zeroes to a number so that it could be read in the correct date format. (DD/MM/YYYY)
        Parameters:
        cal - the number that we will add zeroes to
        Returns:
        the string containing the number with the added zeroes.

      • getTweetsRatesByYear

        @CrossOrigin(origins="http://localhost:63342")
 @RequestMapping(value="/Year")
 @ResponseBody
public HashMap<String,ArrayList<Sector>> getTweetsRatesByYear()
        This method aims to send JSON objects to the Frontend side for the pie graph. The objects returned represent how many risk/benefit/neutral tweets were posted each year.
        First, the method gets all tweets from getTweets() method, loops over all the tweets, and gets year of each tweet and increments the number of that type of tweet in the TypeTweet model. A hashmap with the date as a key and a TypeOfTweets object as its value is used. It then puts it inside the hashmap with the year it was posted on as a key. Afterwards, we iterate through all of the TypeOfTweets model inside the hashmap, creating a model Sector for each year, then a hashmap of sectors is created, with the year as a key once again.
        This is done so that the structure of JSONs could be easily used when received from the client side.
        Returns:
        Hashmap <String, ArrayList<Sector>%gt; hashMap

      • getTotalNumber

        @CrossOrigin(origins="http://localhost:63342")
 @RequestMapping(value="/Numbers")
 @ResponseBody
public TypeOfTweets getTotalNumber()
        This method simply gets the total number of the neutral, risk and benefit tweets.
        Returns:
        TypeOfTweets

      • getUsers

        @CrossOrigin(origins="http://localhost:63342")
 @RequestMapping(value="/Users")
 @ResponseBody
public ArrayList<UsersVennDiagram> getUsers()
        A hashmap stores the user as its key and a list of integers as its value, each indictaing the no of different types of tweets a user has tweeted.
        First, the method gets all tweets using getTweets() method, and loops over all the tweets, check the user and type and and increments the type of tweet this user has tweeted in the hashmap. Then we iterate through the hashmap to put these values inside UsersVennDiagram objects, finally adding them to a list that is later returned.
        Returns:
        ArrayList <UsersVennDiagram> users

      • writeCSVFile

        public static void writeCSVFile(String csvFileName,
                                List<TrainingTweet> trainingTweets)
                         throws IOException
        This method writes TrainingTweets to both a CSV file and an ARFF file.
        In this method only the content and type attributes are written down, as they are the most important features used in classification.
        Parameters:
        csvFileName - The name of the CSV file that will contain the TrainingTweets.
        trainingTweets - A list of TrainingTweets that will be saved to the CSV file.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the writing process is interrupted or fails.

      • writeCSVFileTweets

        public static void writeCSVFileTweets(String csvFileName,
                                      List<Tweet> tweets)
                               throws IOException
        This method writes Tweets to both a CSV file and an ARFF file.
        In this method only the content and type attributes are written down, as they are the most important features used in classification.
        Parameters:
        csvFileName - The name of the CSV file that will contain the TrainingTweets.
        tweets - A list of Tweets that will be saved to the CSV file.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the writing process is interrupted or fails.
